review_title: If Recruiting is this disorganized and discorteous, what must it be like after you sign on?
pros: Being part of a team who have the potential to improve lives through blood donated by a caring and compassionate community.
cons:
Shady organization. 

Recruiters will leave you a message, and only identify themselves by 1st name, without title or reason for call.  If you're a regular blood donor, and someone identifieds themselves only as an employee of Bonfils, your mind goes to "What could be wrong with my blood/me?"; because it's easy to imagine it's a nurse or pathologist who needs to notify you of something grave. 

I had to run through a gauntlet of people before discovering the person who called was a recruiter.

pros: The purpose of the Company is to provide life saving blood to the Colorado healthcare community.  I chose to work here because I wanted my work to have a greater impact other than just earning a check.  Parts of the laboratory favored fresh college graduates and was an good introductory workplace.
cons: Constant management change, constant internal restructuring, three rounds of layoff's within two years (DTL, Warehouse, QSS staff, HR staff, VP's)  There has been an incredible shift to not hire skilled medical technicians or science educated staff, management is shifting towards hiring business mindsets for laboratory work.  No talent stays in management...very fast departures, mobile/collection staff, business development reps and production staff have extremely consistent and high turn over rates.  Increased push on manufacturing productivity is back-breaking and demoralizing to all.  Has no set tiered discpline system, and question the many of the ethical practices in regards to employee rights to complain and not be punished or treated in a hostile fashion.  Company had divided into two buildings and then is in process of merging back into one, very embarrassing that layoff's had to take place due to bad financial choices by management.  Watching the public flagging of our last Medical Director and company president Dr. Dickey on the news and throughout Denver media was absolutely shameful.

review_title: Bonfils is a good place for a paycheck but that is about it.
pros: Develop new skills and can take them elsewhere.  Helping your community blood supply.
cons: No recognition from management and constant pressure to meet unfair goals.  No pay raises in years.  Very low morale in the company.

review_title: Great people, not a great company.
pros:
Some of the most dedicated, passionate people I've ever worked with.
Decent pay, particularly for new grads.
Good benefits, especially health insurance.
cons:
Some managers have difficult personalities.
QA/RA department has been losing all their best employees due to mismanagement. This will hurt them in the long run.
Loss of employees through attrition has resulted in low morale - everyone is doing 3 people's jobs.

Everything. Managment is condescending and rude. They do not care if you have a family. They believe that work comes before all else. You are nothing but a number to them. They make up lies so they can have reasons to fire employees. Lots and lots of favoritism. Staff is can be very childish it makes high school look like a cake walk when it comses to spiteful gossip and vendictive people.  Always whatch your back here.

pros: Good benefits. Some good people to work with.
cons:
Bonfires is a very hypocritical place to work. Not only do you always have to watch your back for who is going to stab you in it, you are constantly walking on egg shells. Management talks about these values that the company is supposed to be held to, all the while it seems to not apply to management at all. For example; and employee will make a mistake and get fired while a supervisor will violate HIPPA laws or break OP and not even get talked to about it. 
Management is a joke. They have no idea how the real world works. So they come up with this great idea to "make things better" and they have never been in the filed to audit how things are done before making these changed. So when they implement things, everything is put is a "rushed" fashion and it is left to the phlebotomists to figure out "how" to make this work. 
They pay is a rate was considered "good" pay 5 years ago. Since denver's cost of living has increased tremendously in the past 5 years, bonfils has not given a cost of living raise nice I had been there. (6 years) 
They do not enforce the chain of command which states "if you have a problem with some one take it up with them first and if it does not resolve then proceed to management". People in the phlebotomy area of this company constantly go to management with petty things like, they did't like the music that was put on at a drive, she/he gave me a dirty look or something stupid and management then pulls that person into the office to have a talk with them. Most of the time these "talks" catch the person completely off guard and they have no idea there was even a problem. These people that snitch are then promoted to team lead and supervisory positions. 
The moral at bonfils is terrible. It is like working at a high school all day. Again, having to walk on egg shells and wonder who is going to stab you in the back next. People there are great at smiling to your face and acting like your friend and that they care, all the while waiting for the chance to get something on you to tell on you to boost their own place in the company. Theres more, but 20 words isn't very much space. :)
Overall, it is a terrible place to work and if you can avoid working there do so. It will destroy your spirit and eat your soul!!!!!
